Anurārāma：A monastery to the north of Mahāgāma in South Ceylon，built by King Vasabha，who also bestowed on it one thousand karīsa of land in the village of Heligāma （Mhv.xxxv.83； MT.652）.

In Vohāratissa’s time the Thera Mahātissa lived there （Mhv.xxxvi.30）. King Vasabha also built an uposatha hall for the vihāra （Mhv.xxxvi.37）.

See also Mahādevarattakurava.
